duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet and establish first contact with patients, update patient demographics, and verify insurance coverage.
Enter and update patient insurance/demographics in the practice management system.
Verify patient insurance coverage prior to appointments and communicate any referrals or authorizations needed.
Process HIPAA-related paperwork and other institutional forms as necessary.
Review waiting room status and keep patients advised of wait times.
Facilitate physician orders in the electronic medical record system and prepare prescription refill requests.
Collect co-pays and payments from patients, ensuring adherence to established cash-control processes.
Schedule surgeries/procedures and verify times with patients; prepare charts, pre-admissions, and consent forms.
Schedule patient follow-up appointments as needed.
Provide patients with guidelines for requesting medical records, perform charge entry tasks, or enter patient payments.
Answer phones for the practice, schedule appointments, and take detailed clinical phone messages.
Follow all HIPAA and governmental requirements for handling PHI documents and initiate reminder phone calls for next day appointments.
Direct patient flow during practice hours and perform other related duties.

education_certification.credential: High School graduate/GED, preferably with 6 weeks of training in a medical office setting
